name: GWYNEDD DEVELOPMENT GROUP, INC., et al., Petitioner, v. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND INDUSTRY, Bureau of Labor Standards, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Gwynedd Development Group, Inc. v. Department of Labor

parties: GWYNEDD DEVELOPMENT GROUP, INC., et al., Petitioner, v. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND INDUSTRY, Bureau of Labor Standards, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 21st day of May, 1996, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is hereby GRANTED, BUT LIMITED to the following issue:
Whether the Wage Payment and Collection Law violates due process by virtue of the prejudgment execution on an employer’s assets if the employer fails to post a bond.
NEWMAN, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this matter.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
675 A.2d 1220
GWYNEDD DEVELOPMENT GROUP, INC., et al., Petitioner, v. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND INDUSTRY, Bureau of Labor Standards, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
May 21, 1996.
